page.title: 09Boddington Farm.
page.content: Boddington Farm was originally owned by Mr.Gibson.In 1976 the Robert Hitchens Group bought the manor and the farm.The farm has 541 acres of grass,wheat,barley,oats,oil seed rape, peas and woodland.Most of this is sold and the rest is fed to cattle. There are 80 pedigree Simmentel cattle 45 bulls around 1 year old. Normally young bullocks sell for about Â£750, the simmentals sell for Â£1500. Breeding is important.The Heywood Esquire is a prize winning Bull that has offspring in Australia, New Zealand,Denmark & Canada. His son 'Heywood ENsign'has 40000 offspring in Ireland. There are 700 breeding ewes, sold for meat.
